messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([0-9]+,\s*)*[0-9]+'

Imagine a castle with 15 rooms. Room 1 is connected to room 7, room 10, room 13, and room 11. Room 2 is connected to room 5, room 8, room 11, and room 14. Room 3 is connected to room 6, room 9, room 12, and room 8. Room 4 is connected to room 7, room 10, room 13, and room 15. Room 5 is connected to room 8, room 11, and room 14. Room 6 is connected to room 9, room 12, and room 15. Room 7 is connected to room 10, and room 13. Room 8 is connected to room 14. Room 9 is connected to room 12 and room 15. Room 10 is connected to room 13. Room 11 is connected to room 14. Room 12 is connected to room 15. You have been told that there is a chest with a reward of 50 for visiting room 8 and there is a chest with a reward of 10 for visiting room 15. Now, from room 1 what is the shortest path that yields the most reward? Remember that you can collect the reward only once and only from one chest. Starting from room 1, please list the room numbers in order, including 1, separated by commas.

user: 1,5
The AI helper responded without any hesitation. The human asked the AI helper to list out the answer, and it did so with efficiency and accuracy. The AI helper proved to be the champion. While solving this task, the AI helper realized that it could use the list of previous tasks to guide itself and use the knowledge gained to help it improve. It also knew that any kind of new input could affect its decision process.
Learning from Data
Say that you are building an AI system and want to use it to understand all the English words that have a definition in Wikipedia. You have two options for your system, depending on whether you want it to learn using examples or without examples. Using examples will cause your system to get some answers right and some answers wrong. You will then be able to feed the correct answers into your system and feed the incorrect answers into the machine. This can be done over and over again until your system is close to 100% accuracy. This procedure is called supervised learning because you are providing the answers that the AI is looking for. For example, you could train your system to identify a tree and send the resulting tree image into the system. Without examples you have to figure out how the system works to know whether it is correct or not. You will not be able to use supervision to improve performance.
The system that uses supervised learning to learn from examples is called ______ machine.
a) _______
Answer: (a) supervised machine
For problems that do not have a set of correct answers, you do not need to create a training data set, because the program is responsible for creating the 'right answer.' The term unsupervised learning is used to describe the process whereby algorithms discover hidden structures, or associations, that can help make predictions about unseen data." In unsupervised learning, you are not sure what the answer is, and the answers come at different levels and different dimensions. The AI helper is able to use unsupervised learning to help create a data set based on past tasks.
The process that uses unsupervised learning to discover hidden structures is called ______ learning.
a) _______ learning
Answer: (a) unsupervised learning
You will see a number of examples of using AI in this book—including those in the following sections—which will take you from building something from scratch to using
